definition: to play/to have fun/to hang out
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
erhua variant of 好玩[hao3 wan2]
to gamble with life/to take reckless risks
to play games/to joke around/to play a joke on sb
beast (derog.)
can't handle it/can't find any way (of doing sth)/not up to the task
to play tricks on sb
finished/to be done with sth
can handle it/up to the task
amateur dramatics
to play tricks
erhua variant of 說著玩|说着玩[shuo1 zhe5 wan2]

sentences.english: Eight-year old Akram plays marbles with his friends in south of Kabul, capital of Afghanistan, in Nov. 2010.
sentences.chinese: 月，在阿富汗首都喀布爾，阿克拉姆與朋友們玩兒球。

sentences.english: The 56-year-old hedge-fund manager has played the contrarian before.
sentences.chinese: 56歲的鮑爾森以前一直玩兒的是反向操作。

sentences.english: Man is the twain, draw play play.
sentences.chinese: 男人就是船兒，划來玩玩兒。

sentences.english: Sandra:I had a great time tonight, but it's getting late.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我玩兒得真高興但天漸漸晚了。

sentences.english: You walked about my seat, playing with blue plums.
sentences.chinese: 你在我凳子邊上轉悠，和藍梅一塊玩兒。

sentences.english: If you want play video games on it, good luck.
sentences.chinese: 假如你想用它玩兒遊戲，那就祝你好運吧。

sentences.english: Particularly he play with arts, and don't pursuit fame and secular.
sentences.chinese: 特別是他“玩兒”藝術，不求功名，不問市儈。

sentences.english: Just really hanging out and trying to spend some time with them.
sentences.chinese: 總之就是出去玩兒，儘量花時間和他們在一起。

sentences.english: A troop of boys were playing at the edge of a pond.
sentences.chinese: 一羣男孩子正在池塘邊玩兒。

sentences.english: Carol and I were even noisier than when we were inside.
sentences.chinese: 我和妹妹玩兒被子王國比在屋子裏還要熱鬧。
他只不過鬧着玩兒罷了。

sentences.english: Playing house, they learn more about how parents feel about their children.
sentences.chinese: 玩兒過家家時，他們學習父母如何關心孩子。

sentences.english: I had a very good evening, Professor Snape.
sentences.chinese: 我今晚玩兒得開心極了，斯內普教授。

sentences.english: Today, however, they were not playing.
sentences.chinese: 可是他們今天沒有在一起玩兒。

sentences.english: Don't unleash your students, they will go crazy after the exams.
sentences.chinese: 不要把你的學生放出去，剛考完試他們會玩兒瘋的。

definition: It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
what are you doing?/whatever for?/why on earth?
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
what are you doing?/what's he up to?
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to know
bored/boring/senseless
boring/of no interest
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
here

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
